meanings.definition: To approve or give permission in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will be preapproving the students' project proposals before they start working on them.
meanings.sent2: The bank is preapproving the loan application before finalizing the paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The preapproving process helps prevent any misunderstandings later on.
meanings.sent4: By preapproving the budget, we ensure a smooth execution of the project.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to preapprove any changes with the supervisor before implementing them.

meanings.definition: The act of granting approval before something is done or allowed.
meanings.sent1: The preapproving of the building plans saved time during the construction phase.
meanings.sent2: She received preapproving for her vacation request, so she booked her flights.
meanings.sent3: The preapproving process streamlined the decision-making for the committee.
meanings.sent4: The preapproving stamp on the document indicated it was ready for the next step.
meanings.sent5: The preapproving of the budget ensured financial compliance with the regulations.
